page.title: 03Research in Harpenden
page.content:
Rothamsted Experimental Station was founded in 1843 by Sir John Bennet Lawes. It is the oldest Experimental Station in England. It employs 700 people many of whom live in Harpenden.
The main aim of the station is to get the best yield from crops and the scientists experiment with soils, fertilisers, crop varieties and water. Insects and crop pests are examined too to see if they have any good uses for man. Bees too are studied to see if honey yield may be increased. Students from all over the world come to observe and learn from the work going on in Harpenden.
One field, Broadbalk has not been touched for 100 years, it shows what Harpenden must have been like before it was settled.
